titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Sanford Chowning, Judgment
CWG9415

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Kentucky Scott Circuit Court
November Term 1860
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against No 193 Misdemeanor
Sanford Chowning Defendant

This day came the Comths attorney & the defendant, and the defendant plead not guilty. Thereupon the following Jurors Wm Nutter, Jeptha Thomason Ed Reed, Wm Penn J. M Pratt M Dehoney Lewis West L. L Herndon, Chas Eckles J. H. Cannon O. H. P. Shropshire, & D. B Pence were sworn to try the issue. & after hearing the evidence rendered the following verdict. "we of the Jury find the defendant is guilty of Keeping a Tipling house L. L. Herndon form" wherefore It is adjudged that the plaintiff recover of the defendant Sixty dollars & the costs of this prosecution
A Cop att James Y Kelly c s c c

Scott Cir. Ct
$60. } Tipling
Sanford Chowning
Respd One Mo
Issd Octo 19 1861
Respite 12 Mo
B. M
Issd Nov 19 1861

send to
Jno Jones Esq
Geo. Town Ky
